basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Lorenzo Carpaneto. After the BSc in Electronical engineering and ICT, I drifted towards Computer Science and Engineering. I'm currently working on my master thesis at polimi. Next year, I will start my career as a software engineer at Meta :) I love coding, playing the guitar and training both at home and outside.

projects.title: Clustering algorithm visualizer
projects.description: After attending the DataMining course, I was curious to understand how to make animations to visualize clustering algorithms... So I have created some python notebooks

projects.title: Masters of Renaissance
projects.description: As a project for a course in university, with a team of three people we have developed the client-server version of the game "Masters of Renaissance". In this project, we have implemented both a CLI and a GUI. The game could be played with a maximum of 4 players and the server was able to handle multiple games simoultaneously.

projects.title: SYP - Secure Your Place
projects.description: As a project for a course in university, with a team of three people we have developed a client-server application to monitor via a device with camera (e.g. raspberrypi) a room or an environment. The device was able to detect if people were in the room: if so, it would send a notification to the user. I have mainly worked on the live-streaming of the video: the server (developed with NodeJS) needed to put in communication the raspberry and the app on the android phone to let former one be able to stream the video. We decided not to publish the app because of the costs due to the server setup (and maintainance).

projects.title: SWERC
projects.description: In my third year of university, I have been selected to participate to SWERC, an international competition of competitive programming.

projects.title: Android simple tutorials
projects.description: Back in the days I was starting programming for Android. I have made some simple tutorials, both in Kotlin and Java, to show how to handle some basic situations (the link sends to the tutorial about ViewModel).

projects.title: Innovathon
projects.description: My team, I Turuk, placed second overall at this competition proposed by Leonardo S.p.A. We had to design and build a vehicle able to move autonomously inside of an ill-lit tunnel to assist injured people with an emergency kit.
